author: sussman
msg: Backport trunk's book to 1.1.x, in preparation for 1.1.0-rc3 release.
As usual, this backport was done by literally copying r10945 of
/trunk/doc/book on top of a 1.1.x working copy's doc/book/ directory.
(At this very moment, there's absolutely no difference between the
book sources in trunk, 1.1.x, or 1.0.x.  But that will change this
week.  http://svnbook.red-bean.com has already been changed to display
two different branches of the book.)

author: sussman
msg: In preparation for book branching, a "final" mass backporting of book changes.
As usual, this backport was done by literally copying r10944 of
/trunk/doc/book on top of a 1.0.x working copy's doc/book/ directory.
This has always been our procedure for preparing docs just before
rolling a release tarball, to guarantee the tarball has the 'latest' docs.
From here on, however, trunk and 1.1.x book are going to be about svn
1.1.  Any book changes relevant to 1.0 must be *explicitly* (and
carefully) backported to the 1.0.x branch, just as we do with code.

author: sussman
msg: Various book improvements, appropriate for both svn 1.0 and 1.1.
(These changes will be backported to the 1.0 branch.)
* doc/book/book/book.xml:
- put "Subversion 1.0" in the book's subtitle, right at the top
of the document.  It's time to plainly differentiate between
the 1.0 and 1.1 versions of the book.
* doc/book/book/ch05.xml:
(Hook Scripts): mention that start-commit and pre-commit hooks
return stderr to the client.  Don't state that pre-commit
hook is the "only" way to get per-directory access control;
instead, xref to mod_authz_svn.
(Migrating):  mention running 'switch --relocate' after doing
a repos migration, since it's an extremely common thing.
* doc/book/book/ch06.xml:
(Per-Directory Authz):  explain that an explictly-mentioned
path in the accessfile will always override inherited
permissions from parent dirs.
(SSH authn):  mention the possible need for 'ssh-agent' or 'pageant'.
* doc/book/book/ch07.xml:
(Externals):  mention that relative paths and files can't be
used in an externals definition.
* doc/book/book/ch09.xml
(svn switch):  verbosify explanation of --relocate option.
* doc/book/book/appc.xml:
(Mapping DeltaV):  correct description of update REPORT.
* doc/book/book/appa.xml):
(Versioned Modules): clarify 'changing definition' of a module.
(Authentication):  explain svn+ssh:// as the exception to the rule.
* TODO:  remove to-dones.

author: jerenkrantz
msg: The goal of Subversion has always been to make me happy!  Or, so my ma told me.
(Note that the installation chokes on Mac OS X, but we think that's due to
a bad Perl install by Apple.)
* STATUS: Vote.
